title: TweetDeck is back up
text:
Tweetdeck, the dashboard management app for Twitter, temporarily went down on Tuesday evening.

Performance issues with the site appeared around 8 p.m. ET.

Attempting to login to Tweetdeck temporarily redirected users to Twitter's mobile site.

As of 1:30 a.m. ET, Tweetdeck was operational again. It is unclear why the site went down.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Tweetdeck, the dashboard management app for Twitter, temporarily went down on Tuesday evening.

According to Outage Report, issues with the site were reported across North and South America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. Performance issues appear to have begun trickling in around 8 p.m. ET.

Attempting to login to Tweetdeck temporarily redirected users to Twitter's mobile site.

"We are aware of issues with Tweetdeck and are investigating. Will circle back when we have more to share," a Twitter spokesperson told Business Insider on Tuesday night.

As of 1:30 a.m. ET, Tweetdeck was operational again. It is unclear why the site went down.

Many users expressed frustration during the outage.

What is going on with @TweetDeck? It told me it no longer had access to my account, then logged me out, and now it redirects to https://t.co/NmsqJbzhKo and I'm not on a mobile device. — Brian Donegan (@WxBrianD) October 2, 2019

Me after Tweetdeck does down. pic.twitter.com/I3rqaiH1U8 — Steve Coogan (@stevenacoogan) October 2, 2019

give me tweetdeck or give me death — Samantha Tomaszewski (@managewski) October 2, 2019

The tool is commonly used by journalists or other content creators in order to monitor news trends and manage content from multiple accounts.
description: TweetDeck, the dashboard management app for Twitter, is back up, after being down temporarily.
